website_summaries.verdict: Offers great quality sound but is much pricier than most other similar smartphone microphones.
pros: Includes a wind shield and 3.5 millimeter cable
Compatible with Apple devices and some Android devices
cons: The app that is recommended to use with the microphone can crash and this microphone is expensive when compared to other similar mics

customer_reviews.title: RØDE hates Amazon
customer_reviews.text: So let me get this straight, RØDE. I purchased a microphone that bears all the marks of being a genuine smartLav+, right down to the leatherette case and etched company logo on the mic clip. But because I bought it from Amazon, you're not going to give me a one-year warranty? How many fingers am I holding up right now?
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Barnhart

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money - You need an app to make it work and the app doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I have never wrote a negative review like this before, but this microphone is a waste of money. To make it work, you need download Rode's app. Sadly, the app constantly freezes and it is so hard to manage when you are in front of a camera juggling a bunch of things. It is advertised as free, but you can't do much with the free version. You have to buy the app to be able to use it to use it to its full potential. So until they come up with a better app that works fast and easy to manage, I wouldn't buy this microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Aysegul D. Sanford

customer_reviews.title: App cost extra, and is also garbage
customer_reviews.text: The Rode Rec app is unacceptable. It costs $6 first of all, and it has the most atrocious interface I've ever seen. Once you've recorded the audio file, you have to jump through many hoops to access it. Having to e-mail myself every single audio file is ridiculous, and that is the easiest option. The last update the app recieved was probably over 5 years ago. It is entirely impossible to respect a company so negligent with their tools, regardless of whether they make good microphones.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: good hardware, bad software
customer_reviews.text: the actual microphone is very good quality for the price. The Rode Rec app, however, is awful. Countless times I have finished recording only to go into the app to realize that it decided to stop recording halfway through. Sometimes it won't upload it to dropbox/soundcloud and it becomes a wasted day
customer_reviews.author: Dylan C

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Great Mic
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mic, but you need to get some software to untap its full potential. Stock, the SmartLav+ picks up a ton of background noise and the quality is not good. I got the RODE Rec app and it sounds way better. It is pricey, but you're getting a quality product from RODE. I have an olympus mic as well and the quality difference does not compare. If you're an indie filmmaker, YouTuber, or need a mic that will reduce background noise by a lot check the RODE SmartLav+ out.
customer_reviews.author: PizzaTek

customer_reviews.title: Okay - but price too high for the quality.
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. Definitely better than the built in mic. Good when using an iPhone attempting to do "professional-ish" videos. For the price, I did think it'd be a more remarkable difference. Not sure if I'd buy again for that price. As another review noted, it's not that much better than the earbuds mic - although this is obviously easier to use discreetly when videoing. If you're just doing audio, save yourself the money and hold the earbuds mic in front of you. It would have also been nice if a code for the app would have been included rather than another $6.
customer_reviews.author: twylak

customer_reviews.title: works great for my purposes.  Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this. Just remember, for your newer i phone 7 plus, you will need the adapter, as this is not wireless. I just used the adapter that came with phone and it worked fine. But you will not be able to charge and use microphone at the same time, because the adapter is plugged into the same port you charge from.
customer_reviews.author: winstoniscute

customer_reviews.title: Great Product but only if you buy from Rode.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. I bought this product a while back and it was amazing! I bought it recently from a Fulfilled by Amazon third party retailer--I got scammed. The product is packaged to look like the real thing but the serial number on the box was covered over by a sticker with a different number. The number is not recognized by the manufacturer. Also, the manufacturer's app (an intensely critical component) doesn't recognize the product as authentic which means it can not access the features that make it an excellent product. Buy the product but ONLY if it is sold by the manufacturer or an authorized reseller. You can visit the company's website to learn more.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Top notch, Pro device, Good price....
customer_reviews.text: Use this to do quick video work for the wife's (business) website. It's one of two Rode mic's I use (the other is the NT1A used in our commercial voiceover studio). The sound is great as is the professional quality of the build. Plans to buy more for multi-person interviews soon. Comes with carry bag, but do note, if you plan on using with the TRRS input of an iOS device you may need the Rode SC4 adapter, due to Apple making changes to THEIR input...
customer_reviews.author: Keep Moving Forward

customer_reviews.title: Simply The Best
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking at this product then you probably already know that Rode is an industry leader. This lav mic is incredibly high quality. I've used it in various different shoots from interviews to speaking engagements and it consistently out performs every other mic. It's become such an integral part of my filming gear that I purchased a backup. No more fussing around with mic audio in post production. My one complaint is that rode does not have a recording app for Android. There are plenty of great alternatives but it would be nice to see some better vertical integration.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan W

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this microphone
customer_reviews.text: I usually use Sennheiser ME2 lavs but decided to give this one a try based off the reviews and success I have had with other Rode products. So far, I am very impressed! I honestly couldn't tell the difference between the the two even though the Senn is at least double the price. I am not a big fan of the required adapter to make this work with my Zoom H1 and other devices, but it's a small annoyance. Overall, I highly recommend this microphone.
customer_reviews.author: arizonahd

customer_reviews.title: Great for professional and casual user on different devices, apps, and configurations
customer_reviews.text: Have used one for four years and just got another to record two people with their own microphone (need SC6 Dual TRRS input for that). This is the best microphone I've ever used for recording interviews and it works great with different apps on my phone. Have used with three different phone models all with great results. It's been reliable, easy to use, and flexible. My only complaint is getting the tiny wire to stay upward in the clip is hard; it keeps coming out. With each movement, it weakens the plastic casing on the microphone wire. But now I just clip it in with the person's clothing instead of separately and there's no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amy L. Gilliland

customer_reviews.title: Good sound for the price but cable broke after a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a casual podcast which I record while walking around my neighborhood. It worked pretty well: the sound was solid (if not as good as the Rode Podcaster), and with a “cat toy” style windscreen, it worked well outdoors. Fast forward 13 months, and I suddenly start getting loud crackling sounds on the audio. It turns out the cable is damaged right where it meets the headphone jack plug, so even the slightest motion triggers it. I haven’t decided if I want to buy another one (vs trying to replace the plug), but either way, I’ll add some extra strain relief.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Reed

customer_reviews.title: No APP for iphone in USA
customer_reviews.text: Total fraud -- full featured app which has QR link in manual isn't available in the USA/my region (that is USA). Information and packaging refers to app but fails to produce it on your phone. Contacted Rode, and haven't heard back yet. Will wait 48hrs and then refund from Amazon plus file fraud complaint to my GA's office against amazon and Rode.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleasantly surprised by this little mic. I usually go throw the hassle of using an external recorder like an H4N with booms or lavs (which is still superior sound) but the set up and ease of this can't be beat. If you're working alone or on quick run and gun interview set ups, this is pretty perfect. Throw it on your subject, plug in your phone, hit record and go. It's that easy and the quality is more than adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Item description is misleading
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my son for Christmas and it was not compatible with his iPhone X, and the window to return it has passed so I am left with something I paid for and cannot use.
customer_reviews.author: Julie711

customer_reviews.title: works great with the iPhone to record audio
customer_reviews.text: works great with the iPhone to record audio. The audio is clean but if you plan on using this product for commercial use, be ready to post-process the audio. I am using the free Rode iphone application to record the audio. For this price, I wish they would just give out the recording application for free. The only drawback is that you need Phantom power for this mic if you plan on using an external audio recorder.
customer_reviews.author: ChakRa

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: This Rode SmartLav+ has remarkable sound quality for being a relatively inexpensive mic. Combined with the Rode extension cable, I've been using this for shooting commercial training videos on an iPad pro. Compared to a wireless system, dealing with the chord is a bit of a pain, but the price and quality are hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: fgr33n

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Clear Sound.
customer_reviews.text: I do a fair amount of iPhone videos for my site and client sites. This little lav is the best I've found so far. And I hate to admit how many mics I've bought. I'm not an audio expert, but I know the difference between audio that makes your video appear amateurish and audio that is solid and clear. This is the best I've been able to find. I have one small gripe. I wish the cord was about one foot longer.
customer_reviews.author: hamilton wallace

customer_reviews.title: Good Product - but sometimes finicky.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mic for my team to use. I work in communications and we often shoot interviews for our marketing material. The mic works well and the sound comes out great. My only con for this mic is that when connecting to a phone/app to the mic, it doesn't always connect 100% of the time. Sometimes we have to reconnect for it to work. Otherwise - the sound quality we get we're very happy with!
customer_reviews.author: Boy Mommy & Family Superhero

customer_reviews.title: Not only for iPhone...!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a small microphone with good quality for a budget price - this is it. I also bought the extension cord and the adapter and I am all set. I won't need another mic as long as this one works. I use it for YouTube videos that I record with my Panasonic G85. I use it for audio recordings with my iPhone. I have also used it with my Zoom H1 mobile recorder. It works and sounds great. If you are in doubt, look for some comparison videos.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Tißler

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: It is very disappointed after knowing this mic does not work with the Rode Wireless GO. I was hoping to get a mic working with my Rode Wireless Go. The production did not say anything about adaptor needed so I went ahead to purchase. Will return it. There are other brands of mic which come with the adaptor for the mic to work with mobile phone and regular recording device. I may go for one of those as they are much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Dream Big

customer_reviews.title: Suitable for the Iphone and tablet only
customer_reviews.text: This mike is made for the IPhone ,( later models of IPhone need an adapter) but many will expect it to work on other audio devices...your PC for one , which it will not ,since the stereo jack is not appropriate being the wrong TRS/TRRS connections... easily fixed with an adapter called a C3. All this should have been made clear in the package
customer_reviews.author: Lincsbairn

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best iPhone lav mic
customer_reviews.text: This is simply the best iPhone lav mic available. The build quality is exceptional. I've done comparisons with this mic verse other lav mics and other mic options in general. The Rode SmartLav+ sounds the best. I'd encourage you to add an extension cable to your order so you can get more than 3-feet away from your camera though. It'll give you a lot more shooting options.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Skibell

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was quick and the mics both work really well. My only knock is that the plastic sheathing where the cable meets the mic is showing a little bit of wire on one of the mics I bought. I got these for a series​ of in-person interviews, so I can't return them just yet, but I might if that wire starts to show any wear. It's a lot of money for a mic, which is fine, so long as that money = quality. I'll update on that later.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one I've bought.
customer_reviews.text: It's the second one I've bought. I think they're that great! For the cost, it's hard to beat this product. Audio is pretty solid... naturally other mics will behave differently, but unless you're audibly trained and a typical snob, SmartLav+ is terrific. I love the versatility of being able to record straight into a phone or (using Rode's TRRS to TRS adapter) recording right into something like the Zoom H1 or a Tascam recorder.
customer_reviews.author: K. Miller

customer_reviews.title: (Recording on Samsung Galaxy Recorder) I've shot 100% of my videos with this mic ever since I've gotten it and hasn't disappoint
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mic a while back and has done wonders. I'm not huge into audio but I know quality when I hear it. The recordings used with this blew me away. (Recording on Samsung Galaxy Recorder) I've shot 100% of my videos with this mic ever since I've gotten it and hasn't disappointed me. Then again, I think it depends on how the person recording the audio edits the audio in post. I've seen and heard many videos with more expensive mics than this and the sound is terrible. I have also seen and heard many videos with this mic where the sound is almost unbelievable. Alright price but definitely a great mic.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: For phone users
customer_reviews.text: It's good if you will use it with phone but if you want with professional gear don't buy it. I purchased this mic for have a back up solution to my wireless recorders but to my utter surprise it would not work with none of my zoom H1 or H5. I have H6 but didn't try with it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ari - NYC

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great. Very durable
customer_reviews.text: Second time buying. First one lasted 4 years and still works. Just has a minor rip in the plastic coating. Played it safe and got a new one. Used for mostly weddings. Great sounds
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Very Good But Not Great
customer_reviews.text: This is convenient, and has enabled me (TV News Reporter) to work from home during the pandemic. If I have one complaint, it is that there is little margin of error for the distance from one's mouth to the mic. Too close and one sounds distorted, too far and it sounds hollow...that is true of all lavs, but this one has a narrower range, and only through trial and error can one get the distance right.
customer_reviews.author: SmokeontheWater

customer_reviews.title: only works with iPhones 5S or older
customer_reviews.text: I had to hunt to learn why this didn't work with my iPhone 8. it only works with iPhones 5S or older. crappy advertising, this just cost me days of work now that I have to return it and wait for another one that is compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Using For Podcast
customer_reviews.text: I used these mics years ago in a marketing role where I gathered user testimonials with a DLSR. Fast-forward to today and I'm making a podcast. These are incredible on sound and fail to disappoint. I bought two so that I could use them during interviews.
customer_reviews.author: Cara Wagner

customer_reviews.title: FOR SMART PHONES - Won't work with Rode Wireless Go!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't actually use this because I purchased it for the Rode wireless GO! mic kit. Be aware this won't work with that (I wish Amazon had said that). I had to send it back and get the right one. I'll give it a 5 star rating because I love their other products--but honestly, I didn't use this.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: It's works only sometimes!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this mic for less than three months and sometimes it works and sometimes it DOESNT! When it works it's great but when it doesn't it mutes the entire recording! I had to throw away an entire day of recordings! That's a days labor gone down the toilet! I want my money back or a replacement but they said my time table for that expired! That's messed up!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey M.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, economical mic!
customer_reviews.text: Really great product! So easy to use and professional. Great sound quality. Remember to get an iPhone adapter if you don’t have one. Highly recommended. I used this for a very important job and was happy with the result. Now I’ll use it for podcasts and to do Facebook Live.
customer_reviews.author: Maryellen Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Mic!
customer_reviews.text: Great lav mic! picks up sound well and is very directional so you dont get too much backround noise.. we did have to buy a connector cord to connect it to our osmo.. dont know if that would be with every camera though.
customer_reviews.author: nnyladnama

customer_reviews.title: this mic is great! Very high quality
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was defective at first because I needed the adapter for my DSLR, but once I finally figured it out, this mic is great! Very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, small and works with other wireless kits.
customer_reviews.text: I paired with my azden pro-xd cheap wireless kit and the sound is MUCH nicer! Its on the smaller side. The windscreen has rubber on the bottom so it doesn't fall off every time you put it up someones shirt. Great lav, only downside is it could be a tiny bit smaller for the price and the clip could rotate so you could clip it onto either side of a jacket like some lav mics do. Video review/tests on youtube.com/peglegmediafl
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Not Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Simply not reliable. Throughout all my interview recording there are repeatedly sharp drop outs where there is no sound for a couple frames along with a static peaking sound. If you are doing anything even moderately professional, do yourself a huge favor and buy yourself a lav system you can count on and save yourself from the stress this thing induces.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Z.

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play:  Easy & Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this: was acquired for a non-profit where we record weekly talks to be published online. Extremely easy to use (in the true spirit of "plug-n-play") and beautiful sound. Great price-point, too. I want another one -with the proper adapter for smartphones- so I can do interviews!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Acker

customer_reviews.title: Tiny!
customer_reviews.text: Rode makes great mics, this lav is tiny! The cord is almost 4ft long and super thin. The sound quality is amazing from such a small mic. My only complaint is that the mic is 3.5mm TRRS, while most cameras are TRS requiring an adapter. Comon Rode make a TRS version!
customer_reviews.author: Waves & Trails

customer_reviews.title: Great Omni mic
customer_reviews.text: I had a bit of trouble at first and then found out it was my adapter for my iPhone. I bought the knock off lightning to 3mm and it didn’t work at all. Then I bought the one directly from Apple and the microphone worked like a champ. Super clear and pics up quite a bit. I use it to capture audio while I approach people in the street and talk to them while filming with my GoPro. I end up hearing everyone really well.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: awesome but........
customer_reviews.text: So I would give it 5 stars due to the GREAT sound quality. My voice sounds amazing on it. First Mic I like. However 1 star off due to the fact I cant record outside due to it picking up on the wind so easily.
customer_reviews.author: cadoia

customer_reviews.title: Great For Video or Audio on iPhones
customer_reviews.text: I recently started using this a couple of weeks ago and I'm very pleased with it. I mainly use it for short videos taken with my iPhone 6 Plus and it works just great, however I wish the cord was a bit longer. I've tried looking for a suitable extension but haven't found one that is suitable. One that I purchased from Best Buy works but the sound quality is terribly diminished when it's attached. I'll eventually probably invest in a transmitter/receiver belt pack but for just straight iPhone videos without having to use the earbuds with mic, this has worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis The Mentalist

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Just started using them in the field today
customer_reviews.text: Today I started work on a short film project and can't begin to adequately describe how completely satisfied I am with the set of SmartLavs I purchased a while ago. Being able to load the Rode Rec app my iPhone and get clean, high quality audio that can be immediately uploaded to my Dropbox account between set ups I s a true time saver. These lavs work great - buy a couple and see for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: jamoreno42

customer_reviews.title: Very nice lavalier mic for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound quality, exactly what I hoped it would be. My previous lab was good, but this was definitely a step up, and a worthwhile purchase. Didn’t need the additional app since I will be processing in afterproduction.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Minot

customer_reviews.title: Really good mic with a really crappy app.
customer_reviews.text: I snagged a couple of these to use in my video work and have been very happy them. I actually bought the adapter so I could use them with small Tascam recorders instead of my iPhone because the Rode recording app is god-awful. I have been much happier using it with small recorders instead, and would recommend those over the app.
customer_reviews.author: A. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Worthless after just a few uses. Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: For the price I would have expected this mic to last longer. I've had it for a few months and used it occasionally with pretty good results. BUT now it is very static-y, so its useless. Very disappointed in the durability. I was careful with storing it too. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: somatickristin

customer_reviews.title: Captures good sound
customer_reviews.text: It does a really good job of capturing my voice with clarity. I bought this as an extra for my wireless lapel setup and the sound is better with this mic than the one it came with.
customer_reviews.author: DesertShopper

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great.
customer_reviews.text: Using this along with a webcam so that I don't have to wear a headset during video calls. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: A. Holub

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little microphone
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little microphone. Do be aware that the plug on this is a TRRS, and thus is made for iphones, ipads and such devices in which one plug port serves for both headphone and microphone use. If plugged into the mic input of a digital DSLR camera such as a Nikon D5200 or D7100 as a remote microphone, it will not work, since those mic inputs are for mics only and not for headphones, therefore they require a TRS plug. To make this great RODE microphone work as your remote mic on your DSLR you need to buy  - the RODE adapter. It is totally worth it, and it expands the usefulness of your RODE lavalier microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I really don’t have any complaints for what I use this for: audio capture on an old iPhone 6 for vlogging/corporate videos. I don’t use the app and used a third party one found in the App Store.
customer_reviews.author: Conspicuous Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Expectations met with Rode smartLav+
customer_reviews.text: I definitely noticed a difference in the quality of my sound. I use a MEVO to live stream and the audio quality was not good. So I bought this to attach to my android to capture the sound through the phone. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy King Production

customer_reviews.title: I like it, I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.text: Got this with Rode SC3 (TRRS to TRS / 4 connector to 3) to go with the Zoom H1. Sounds amazing!! Better than ME2 mic from Sennheiser, due to having a 90 degree (from the SC3) and recording into both L and R channels, not just one Mono. I am no Audio Expert as to quality of the Audio versus other mics, but for me and using for interviews it sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: KickAClay

customer_reviews.title: DiDN'T HELP! Very Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this mic so that I could make better quality sounding youtube videos. While the size/packaging was fine... the mic doesn't seem to make a difference either way. If I plug it into my computer, it has the same crappy issues my computer has. If I plug it into my phone, it sounds better because my phone is better... but it doesn't make it better than my phone. I feel like this was such a waste of money! DO NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: valerie bowden

customer_reviews.title: Was awesome, now I need help!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing WAS awesome, even with the rode rec app. I was recording interviews and the audio quality was perfect no humming, background noise, nothing...it worked great. Then rode had an update for the app, so I updated it and now it's terrible! Basically writing a review to see if anyone else had this problem and got it working good again? Helpppppppppp
customer_reviews.author: ORF

customer_reviews.title: Your Apple iPhone is better!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I could use this to plug into my phone and record people on their wedding days. We did a comparison between my iPhone 8 Voice Memo recorder and the Rhode Rec app that was required by the app, and the iPhone 8 sounded much better. The smartLav+ sounds a lot lower than a normal voice memo recording. In the end, it wasn't really worth it and I ended up sticking to my Zoom H5 to record audio.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Best Little Lavalier Microphone
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this little mic. It's small, yet good quality, sturdy, and provides excellent sound. You may also want to purchase an extension cable to provide more distance between the camera and subject.
customer_reviews.author: Riley's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: The audio quality on this is great. I recorded some audio of me talking next to a medical laser that sounds like a lawnmower, and the audio came out very clear. I'm really happy with this (coupled with my old iPhone as a recorder).
customer_reviews.author: Summit

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Visually nice, but terrible sound quality. Simple wired earbud mics work as well or better. I’d suggest that route over this cost. Not to mention the demanded extra cable in most cases. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Works With Pixel 3
customer_reviews.text: Bought for use on my Pixel 3. It plugs into the adapter included with the Pixel 3. Started recording automatically, didn't have to install anything for it to use the mic as the default recording hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: great. But the cable is too delicate
customer_reviews.text: The microphone works, great. But the cable is too delicate; if you are not careful, you will start getting cable noises into your recording, if that happens you will have to buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Fede312

customer_reviews.title: Great mics
customer_reviews.text: These mics sound great and are easy to use, it improves the sound quality of any interview that you make shooting videos with an iOS device
customer_reviews.author: Edgaba

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: very good quality microphone! has highly improved the quality of my videos without investing over 300$ on pro lav systems, this plugged to a zoom recorder will do the job very well. Would not recommend using it with the native rode app as it lags and crashes a lot, I lost some audios at the beginning so i decided to use this as a lav system with a recorder (you gotta buy the adapter and it only works with zoom recorders from what i see, it didnt work with my tascam). Overall good addition to your gear kit!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Fernanda Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great Lavalier Microphone for Mobile Recording
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this mic for a while now and it works pretty well. It tends to have a lot more hiss than my Blue Nessie mic, but is convenient enough that I don't mind the extra work to reduce the hiss. The packaging is roughly the size of a smart phone. It comes with the lavalier mic, a lapel clip, a wind screen, and a storage bag. Setup is easy and the mic can be plugged directly into a PC for voice over recording or into a smart phone for mobile recording.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: The wire is ridiculously small!
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but feel I had to for this one. Rode advertises that this mic can be plugged right into your smartphone, which it can and I'm sure when it is, it does a great job. The problem is that the wire attached to the mic is ridiculously small. I don't have a tape measurer near me but the wire might only be 4 or 5 feet long. As a result, any video I do would have to be absurdly close to my face. This is really disappointing and just absurd.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Opened Item and Tears
customer_reviews.text: I received this product and it was clearly teared open. It looks like the item had been tampered with or used. I'm concerned this is not an authorized dealer of this product. I reached out to Rode to find out. Regardless, I am skeptical of the fact that I received the product like this.

customer_reviews.title: Rhodes Microphone is a Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The Rhodes microphone came highly recommended. I tested it and it works great. Sound quality is very good. Looking forward to using it because it will help with reducing background noise.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Lukewarm 3
customer_reviews.text: When this is working it has a good sound quality. I have had two of them and had to return them both because the sound began to become static and crackled. I am hoping three times is the charm. If this one fails again I am returning it and getting another brand. The only reason I am giving this 3 stars is because the initial quality is good. Lasting less than a month, with not much use, for the first two isn't a good track record. We shall see!
customer_reviews.author: Terry B

customer_reviews.title: Could not connect to laptop
customer_reviews.text: I could not get my laptop to recognize this device as a microphone. I would plug it in, search for devices, and it was never recognized as an audio input device. Did not work at all for me.
customer_reviews.author: AceOfSpades

customer_reviews.title: I used this in conjunction with the RODE iPhone app and it works great. Also
customer_reviews.text: Incredible Product. Had really low expectations for a lav mic tailored for smartphones but it worked to perfection in an interview, completing negating the loud AC. I used this in conjunction with the RODE iPhone app and it works great. Also, it's worth getting the Rode SC3 3.5mm TRRS to TRS Adaptor to enable this lav to be compatible with the 3.5mm jack on DSLRs and mirrorless cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Jake M.

customer_reviews.title: Works with my iPhone 7 Plus
customer_reviews.text: I've used this with the "memos" App and it records when plugged into the headphone dongle. Sound quality is good and there is no noise issue. The only thing I would change is to have the chord be a bit longer, but you can always use an extension if needed.
customer_reviews.author: LA DIY

customer_reviews.title: Good audio for low budget projects
customer_reviews.text: Smatlav+ does not work properly on my Asus Android phone, it keeps clipping (I think it's the limitation on the phone instead of the mic). Eventually I bought Rode SC3 3.5mm TRRS to TRS Adaptor to connect to Zoom H1. I think this combination is one of the cheapest for interview that still gets decent result. I also bought Edutige Lavalier Microphone ETM-006, but Smartlav+ is better: less noise, cleaner audio, smaller mic head (visually important). For Voice Over, I use Zoom h1 with windscreen and the audio is useable for TV standard. I heard OST-801 is also good at this price range ($87 with 3.5mm plug to Zoom H1). This will probabaly my next purchase if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Fang Ministry

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after a couple weeks. Buyers beware some other poor ratings, too
customer_reviews.text: It worked for a couple of weeks and then stopped working, as if it 'shorted out' or something. I was using in an iPhone 6+. I have low expectations for $15 mics, but not $79 ones. Disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: BrianPDX

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but probably worth it

With such a flimsy and thin cable, I feared I was going to end up ripping the cable in half trying to get it in. Be very careful when handling!

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiding it away
customer_reviews.text: Cable is a little short and definitely thin. Great for hiding it away, not for handling any kind of pressure. Get an extension cable.

customer_reviews.title: Works well and does what it should!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to be able to record audio from two (Rode SmartLav+) microphones into my (Canon Rebel T5i) DSLR camera, and this accomplishes that with the aid of the SC6 dual input hub/box-thing. Lav mics > extension cables > SC6 dual-input/headphone output > TRRS to TRS adapter > DSLR camera There are a lot of links in that chain but at least it all works!

product_meta.title: Rode SmartLav+ Omnidirectional Lavalier Microphone for iPhone and Smartphones, Black
product_meta.description: The RODE Microphones smartLav+ provides high-quality audio to your smartphone or tablet. If your in the film, television, or broadcasting field, you need a lavalier microphone. You can capture crisp, defined audio with a lapel mic that weighs less than a pound. The omnidirectional condenser capsule captures audio from all directions and the included foam pop filter eliminates vocal plosives. Although ideal for the RODE's Rec app for your iOS device, any audio app that accepts audio from the headset input will be compatible with the RODE Microphones smartLav+ lavalier microphone.
